Package io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model

Contains the models that store mutable data values for this program.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Portfolio
    An interface defining the methods of a stock portfolio object.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GUIStateModel
    A JavaBean bound property model that defines the current state of the GUI of the StockMarket program.
    PortfolioModel
    A JavaBean bound property model storing the values defining a stock portfolio in the StockMarket program.
    SQLPortfolioModel
    An extension of the standard PortfolioModel to integrate a field for a SQL userid primary key.
    StockDisplayModel
    A JavaBean bound property model defining the value of the stock currently being displayed in the program.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    InsufficientFundsException
    Exception that is thrown by when there is not enough funds available to make a transaction.

Package io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model Description

Contains the models that store mutable data values for this program. As the user interacts with the GUI, information about the program's state is stored in the models in this class. Models pass updated state information to the view via PropertyChangeEvents, following the JavaBean bound property format.

All models extend AbstractPropertyModel from the MVP Framework. The framework handles updating and listening to these models, ensuring a dependency inverse relationship between them and the other elements of this program.

There are three main models in this package. GUIStateModel focuses on tracking the current state which UI elements are enabled/displayed at any given time. StockDisplayModel tracks which stock is current selected to be displayed in the main part of the window. And the PortfolioModel tracks the current contents of the user's stock portfolio.

Since:
Version 2.0
Author:
Craig
